hotstepper.analysis.statistics module

hotstepper.analysis.statistics.acf(steps, maxlags=10)

Calculates the Auto Correction Function for the steps data.

Parameters

  • steps (class::Steps) – Steps object to perform calculation.

  • maxlags (int, Optional) – The maximum number of step key look backs to perform analysis.

Returns

Return type

array, array

See also

Steps.histogram(), Steps.ecdf(), Steps.pacf()

References

1

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Partial_autocorrelation_function

hotstepper.analysis.statistics.correlation(st, other)
hotstepper.analysis.statistics.covariance(st, other)
hotstepper.analysis.statistics.describe(st, precision=2, return_dataframe=True)

Generate a table containing a number of standard statistical metrics for the steps data.

hotstepper.analysis.statistics.ecdf(steps)

Calculates the Empirical Cummulative Distribution Function for the steps data.

Parameters

steps (class::Steps) – Steps object to perform calculation.

Returns

Return type

array, array

See also

Steps.histogram(), Steps.pacf()

References

1

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empirical_distribution_function

hotstepper.analysis.statistics.histogram(steps, bins=None, axis=0, ts_grain=None)

Calculates a histogram for the corresponding step function values

Parameters

  • steps (class::Steps) – Steps object to perform calculation.

  • bins (int, Optional) – The number of bins the data will be grouped into for analysis

  • axis (int, Optional (rows -> y values)) – The axis to use to generate the histogram. axis = 0; will use row data that represents the equivalent y values of the steps data. axis = 1; will use column data that represents the equivalent x values of the steps data.

Returns

Return type

array, array

See also

Steps.ecdf(), Steps.pacf()
